intro: Greeniopsis sibuyanensis, commonly known as the Sibuyan greeniopsis, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in montane forest habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are opposite and lanceolate, with a smooth texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
